items.sentence: Tom and Mary play tennis together every afternoon.
I have a few things to finish up before I go home.
Tom was with a customer, so I didn\'t talk to him.
I knew that Tom wouldn\'t be able to get the loan.
I don\'t know yet, but I\'ll find out soon enough.
Tom swore that he didn\'t tell anybody our secret.
Tom, you\'re pretending to be asleep, aren\'t you?
I suspect that Tom is waiting for us in the lobby.
Why do some people have dimples and others don\'t?
Tom was walking too fast for us catch up with him.
We can\'t repair the damage done by Tom\'s speech.
Tom hardly ever does what you\'d expect him to do.
There was a birch tree in our garden, but it died.
Tom asked me who was responsible for the accident.
Tom ate all the ice cream that was in the freezer.
Tom says he doesn\'t know why Mary went to Boston.
Tom looked after the children yesterday afternoon.
Tom looks a lot more like your father than you do.
Mary was brushing her hair in front of the mirror.
Why don\'t you try getting to bed earlier tonight?
I didn\'t know Tom was planning to move to Boston.
I didn\'t know Tom was so good at speaking French.
I didn\'t know how to do that until Tom showed me.
I didn\'t know that there was anything else to do.
Would you tell Tom why you don\'t like doing that?
Would you tell Tom why you don\'t want to do that?
Tom asked me why I didn\'t live in Boston anymore.
I think Tom didn\'t want Mary to go out with John.
Tom has been collecting stamps since he was a kid.
Tom is my neighbor, but I hardly ever talk to him.
Christmas has always been a wonderful time for me.
Could you verify that your computer is plugged in?
Tom and I could\'ve done that faster by ourselves.
Tom and I should\'ve taken care of that ourselves.
You should inspect the car well before you buy it.
Have you been listening to what I\'ve been saying?
Let\'s hope things go more smoothly the next time.
Tom isn\'t supposed to do that without permission.
Tom isn\'t supposed to smoke at work, but he does.
Tom isn\'t the only one here who can speak French.
Tom isn\'t the type of person I want to deal with.
I had some custard pudding for an afternoon snack.
I had to make sure Tom was still planning to come.
I have a lot of friends I can discuss things with.
Tom didn\'t want to spend any more time with Mary.
Tom didn\'t want to spend as much money as he did.
Tom didn\'t want to take over the family business.
Tom asked us a few questions and we answered them.
Tom bumped into Mary and spilled his drink on her.
The roof of Tom\'s house was damaged in the storm.
